column1: Erestor was the chief counsellor of [[Elrond]]'s household at the time of the [[War of the Ring]]; as such, he took part in the [[Council of Elrond]]. He did not support the idea of destroying [[The One Ring
column2: The Ring]], and preferred instead the notion of guarding it from [[Sauron]], perhaps with the aid of [[Tom Bombadil
column3: Iarwain ben-adar]]. His suggestion was countered by [[Glorfindel]], as well as [[Galdor of the Havens
column4: Galdor]], as they didn't believe that Iarwain had the power to defy Sauron's.<ref>{{FR

column1: Erestor accompanied [[Arwen]] to her marriage to [[Gondor]] in {{TA

column3: Erestor from ''[[The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game]]''

column1: '''2001-2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game]]'':'''
:A Decipher card identifies one of the Elves at the [[Council of Elrond]] in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]'', played by [[Jonathan Harding]], as Erestor.
